item.title: School Sketches by Finnian MacManus
item.description: These are some sketches I did when I was studying as a student a long time ago. I thought it would be fun to show some of them online. I would have done a lot of these differently with my approach now but I can see how each of them had an influence on the style I used today.
item.content:encoded:
These are some sketches I did when I was studying as a student a long time ago. I thought it would be fun to show some of them online. I would have done a lot of these differently with my approach now but I can see how each of them had an influence on the style I used today.

View this on ArtStation
Finnian MacManus on ArtStation

item.title: Scifi Structures and Props Kitbash Set released ! Over 100 Models. by Finnian MacManus
item.content:encoded:
I am happy to say that today Terraform Studios launches two Scifi Kitbash Sets !! You can get them here: https://www.artstation.com/terraformstudios/store
One for Buildings and one for Props. In total there are over 100 models between the two packs ! These are structures and props you can use in ANY 3D scene, they were created in Blender but available in all common formats. Amazing work by Kevin Jick https://www.artstation.com/kevinjick for the Pack and Pablo Dominguez https://www.artstation.com/pablodominguez for the cover art.

https://www.artstation.com/terraformstudios/store

item.title: Lentana Street by Finnian MacManus
item.description: Collaboration with https://www.artstation.com/kevinjick for the new Terraform Studios Scifi Props Kitbash Pack ! Kevin designed some incredible buildings and props (93 props total!) that would be perfect for any science fiction interior or exterior scene. They are now for sale on our store here: https://www.artstation.com/terraformstudios/store

item.title: Ruins Kitbash & Medium Tutorial out now!~ by Finnian MacManus
item.content:encoded:
Hey all ! Terraform's first kitbash set and Medium tutorial are out now ! You can get them from my store, or at Terraform Studios here:
https://www.artstation.com/terraformstudios/store 

Terraform Studios presents its first Kitbash pack for Medium by Adobe  with a Ruin theme ! Perfect for ancient temples, forgotten cities, both interior and exterior. This pack was created inside of Medium by Adobe  and is a high voxel polycount- The meshes are also available in FBX format for use as normal kitbash pieces.

BUNDLE DEAL! Included is a 45 MInute Medium by Adobe  tutorial, showing the basics on how to design inside the program in VR, and also a run down of the stamp tool. Starting with a few pieces from this kitbash set, Finnian MacManus  creates the first step in the cover image for this pack; the ruined temple. Narrated Live.

Included:
-70 Medium Stamps already exported

-70 FBX versions of the Medium Stamps (High Polygon- Not textured)

-Blender Files of the Meshes with Textures

-Sand and Rock Texture Maps used in Showcase

-45 Minute Adobe Medium Tutorial on Design and Stamp Tool

-Stamp Installation Video

item.title: Palace of Ahdrassi by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
The Palace of Ahdrassi, part of the Blue Valley Project. Ahdrassi is a queen who is known for reclaiming land lost in the great war with the capital, and bringing it back to life through growing new architecture. Here you can see she is addressing the People's Senate.

This piece was commissioned for Medium by Adobe, and was sculpted inside the program. The new update is live, get it now!
item.content:encoded:
The Palace of Ahdrassi, part of the Blue Valley Project. Ahdrassi is a queen who is known for reclaiming land lost in the great war with the capital, and bringing it back to life through growing new architecture. Here you can see she is addressing the People's Senate.

This piece was commissioned for Medium by Adobe, and was sculpted inside the program. The new update is live, get it now!

View this on ArtStation

The Palace of Ahdrassi. Ahdrassi can be seen giving a speech to the people's Senate.

item.title: Ruins of Navranda by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
Cover image for Terraform studio's first Kitbash Set: Ruins ! The pack contains 70 3d models that can be used both as FBX and as stamps. It also contains a full Medium stamp tutorial.
https://www.artstation.com/marketplace/p/150z/ruins-kitbash-medium-tutorial-bundle

Using the pack I sculpted the ruins 3D model, then created shaders in Cinema 4D, rendered in Octane and painted over in Photoshop.
This image will have a full tutorial coming soon
item.content:encoded:
Cover image for Terraform studio's first Kitbash Set: Ruins ! The pack contains 70 3d models that can be used both as FBX and as stamps. It also contains a full Medium stamp tutorial.

Using the pack I sculpted the ruins 3D model, then created shaders in Cinema 4D, rendered in Octane and painted over in Photoshop.

item.title: Sketching for Film, First tutorial! by Finnian MacManus
item.content:encoded:
Hey all ! My first tutorial is finally here. You can catch it in the link below:

https://www.artstation.com/terraformstudios/store 


"In this Concept art for Film: Pre Production Tutorial, Finnian MacManus takes you through his creative process of designing a blue sky sketch.

Starting with a brief, Finn will explain the 2D techniques he uses on a daily basis to quickly create and realize a concept; including how to get brilliant color, lighting, composition, values, and many thoughts on design theory as well. Don't miss this full 1-hr Narrated tutorial, including a homework assignment at the end for those who want to continue practicing."

item.title: Sketching for Film Tutorial by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
Concept design from my new tutorial, sketching for film! A pre production sketch tutorial, including some brushes, my thoughts on design theory, color, technique and much more.
You can find the tutorial here:
https://www.artstation.com/terraformstudios/store
https://www.terraformstudios.com/
https://gumroad.com/terraformstudios

item.title: Terraform Studios has Launched! by Finnian MacManus
item.description: Launch of Terraform Studios, Concept Art Partnership studio. Sourcing the best concept art talent worldwide.
item.content:encoded:
I am really excited to announce that a few months ago I founded Terraform Studios, a Concept Art Partnership Studio with some of the best concept artists worldwide. Since our founding we have been working on a variety of feature films, AAA games and tv projects .  It has been an amazing experience working with some of the best artists in our industry and I couldn't be more proud of the team and how this has all come together so quickly. You can check out our work and website at https://www.terraformstudios.com/ .

Our Artstation account is https://www.artstation.com/terraformstudios 

Keep your eyes out ! We will be releasing tutorials, kitbash packs and interviews in the near future .

item.title: Luithica by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
Luithica is the Antagonist faction in the Blue Valley IP that I have been developing.
The dreaded forces of Shal Tah sweep through the peaceful Blue Valley landscape, using their Terramancers to transform the environment into an inhospitable wasteland that only the forces of Luithica can settle.

This section portrays the Terrmancing towers and introduces Shal Tah , the head of Luithica's council. I wanted to revisit the form language for this area which is inspired by many sculptors in particulat janez boljka.

Assets were primarily sculpted in Adobe Medium, with the ships being done in Gravity Sketch. Rendered in Octane for Cinema 4D and painted over in Photoshop. More to come!

Blue Valley:
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/n45br
Burning Lakes:
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/WPAkD

https://www.instagram.com/fmacmanus/
item.content:encoded:

The dreaded forces of Shal Tah sweep through the peaceful Blue Valley landscape, using their Terramancers to transform the environment into an inhospitable wasteland that only the forces of Luithica can settle.

This section portrays the Terrmancing towers and introduces Shal Tah , the head of Luithica's council. I wanted to revisit the form language for this area which is inspired by many sculptors in particulat janez boljka.

Assets were primarily sculpted in Adobe Medium, with the ships being done in Gravity Sketch. Rendered in Octane for Cinema 4D and painted over in Photoshop. More to come!

item.title: Xulith by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
Xulith is a city from Blue Valley (https://www.artstation.com/artwork/n45br)

Created as a demo for my Form language & VR Class at New3dge school in Paris, France over a two week period.

I showed the students how to use form language and design principles to create a culture and civilization, starting with architecture and props, and then how to model and paint the city in a quick fashion to allow for variations!
Had a blast creating this !! I used Photoshop for the painting, Medium for the models and Cinema 4D + Octane for the renders.
item.content:encoded:
Xulith is a city from Blue Valley (https://www.artstation.com/artwork/n45br)

Created as a demo for my Form language & VR Class at New3dge school in Paris, France over a two week period.

I showed the students how to use form language and design principles to create a culture and civilization, starting with architecture and props, and then how to model and paint the city in a quick fashion to allow for variations!
Had a blast creating this !! I used Photoshop for the painting, Medium for the models and Cinema 4D + Octane for the renders.

item.title: 3D Printed Ships - Ad Astra by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
3D Printed ships concept for Ad Astra 2019!
I havent seen the movie yet, but an original concept was that at the end, there would be a ship to take Brad Pitt out of the station,
so I explored ways of designing the ship to look printed while maintaining grounded aesthetics, and then experimented with some more unusual variations.
Thanks to Step Zavala for art direction!
Copyright ILM
item.content:encoded:
3D Printed ships concept for Ad Astra 2019!
I havent seen the movie yet, but an original concept was that at the end, there would be a ship to take Brad Pitt out of the station,
so I explored ways of designing the ship to look printed while maintaining grounded aesthetics, and then experimented with some more unusual variations.
Thanks to Step Zavala for art direction!
Copyright ILM

View this on ArtStation
Finnian MacManus on ArtStation





(This last one uses negative space in a car's frame as reference- I know this has no impact on a spaceship, was more aesthetic)

item.title: Ascent- Ad Astra by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
*This one was an exercise in negative space *
One of the ideas in Ad Astra that I believe changed later on was to rise from Mars' atmosphere using a balloon ! Had a fun time composing this shot. For Ad Astra 2019.
Copyright ILM

item.title: Spacewalk to Lima - Ad Astra by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
Concepts for the Neptune sequence in Ad Astra 2019.
First shot is a launch from Brad Pitt's ship to go through Neptune's ring, using a solar panel as a shield.
Then a sequence as he approaches Lima Station.

Thanks to Step Zavala for art direction!
Copyright ILM

item.title: Weekly Sketches 7/12 by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
I was honored to give a lecture and demo at Ramon Lulle Lasalle University Barcelona.
The idea was to cross the form language of bones and a satellite dish
Thanks to my good friend Rafa for inviting me.

This was a one hour demo i did from start to finish for the students there-
20 minutes sculpt
10 minutes lighting/render
30 minutes paintover in Photoshop

Sculpted in oculus Medium. The other gray renders were taken after the demo was finished.

The other below are some weekly sketches for Blue Valley and Burning Lakes!
item.content:encoded:
I was honored to give a lecture and demo at Ramon Lulle Lasalle University Barcelona.
The idea was to cross the form language of bones and a satellite dish

item.title: Ascomycota by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
A Mushroom/Radish creature mix for Creatuanary!!

Happy to be a part of the book coming out later this year!
If you are interested in the project, you can check out the Publication info here:
https://www.bypublications.com/product/creatuanary/

Also big shoutout and thanks to my good friends for letting me submit art, check out their inspiring work!!

item.title: Watchtower by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
The growing of any structure is a very important ceremony in the Blue Valley - As each piece of architecture is living and unique, the process for growing a functional building has become a somewhat spiritual task.

Guiding local small deities into the structure, plant weavers will assemble many seeds to begin their art. As each portion of the building is completed, like a construction worker, the weavers attach and grow new rooms and spaces to the ever changing landscape.

Part of a series on Blue Valley! You can see the original project here:
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/n45br
item.content:encoded:
The growing of any structure is a very important ceremony in the Blue Valley - As each piece of architecture is living and unique, the process for growing a functional building has become a somewhat spiritual task.

Guiding local small deities into the structure, plant weavers will assemble many seeds to begin their art. As each portion of the building is completed, like a construction worker, the weavers attach and grow new rooms and spaces to the ever changing landscape.

Part of a series on Blue Valley! You can see the original project here:
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/n45br

View this on ArtStation
Finnian MacManus on ArtStation


Muvala means Watchtower in the Blue Valley dialect. Watchtowers are grown by mixing several types of seeds together in soil on the border with Burning Lakes.


To start the growth of a structure, several plant weavers confer and attempt to guide powers into the architecture seed.


Depending on the seeds used, the structure will grow spires, large interior rooms, bedrooms etc.


Process in Photoshop

item.title: ModernDay James Podcast by Finnian MacManus
item.content:encoded: Hello Guys! If you are curious about my process for images, or what inspires me, and some ramblings about my life, I did a podcast this week with ModernDay James and the great Alec Palacios! Thought to post about it here in case people are interested! You can find the link below. On the channel as well.

item.title: Relic of the Seven Dawns by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
More worldbuilding commissioned by SevenLions - Was fun contributing some lore to the world!
Both interiors sculpted in Medium, rendered in Octane and then painted over. You can find the process videos for the interiors below.
Sequel images to :
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/lVxGNY
item.content:encoded:
More worldbuilding commissioned by SevenLions - Was fun contributing some lore to the world!
Both interiors sculpted in Medium, rendered in Octane and then painted over. You can find the process videos for the interiors below.
Sequel images to :
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/lVxGNY

View this on ArtStation
Finnian MacManus on ArtStation


Relic of the Seven Dawns- Shrine Chamber


Relic of the Seven Dawns - Syphoning


Prop designs - for these I was thinking different religious/holy items, inspired off of this culture's mythical beliefs


Individual shrines devoted to separate deities . Mitsara of the Flower Bel the Grave Tender Atheon the Wise


First round of thumbnails on the top with the original red temple design, and below the second round with expanded and more of a white/yellow temple interior


Some other options for views, gray renders of the scenes.


Interior 1 Process


Interior 2 Process

item.title: Vestige of the Seven Dawns by Finnian MacManus
item.description:
I was hired to do some worldbuilding for Seven Lions earlier this year within his IP, Vestige of the Seven Dawns. Was really happy to do some work for his team as they wanted to do a full design process which was very fun! I believe these were animated and then played together with his sets this year.
I ended up sculpting the design they chose with Medium, which has a process video above, and then painting over. There are some interior shots as well I will upload soon.
Copyright Seven Lions 2018
item.content:encoded:
I was hired to do some worldbuilding for Seven Lions earlier this year within his IP, Vestige of the Seven Dawns. Was really happy to do some work for his team as they wanted to do a full design process which was very fun! I believe these were animated and then played together with his sets this year.
I ended up sculpting the design they chose with Medium, which has a process video above, and then painting over. There are some interior shots as well I will upload soon.
Copyright Seven Lions 2018

View this on ArtStation
Finnian MacManus on ArtStation


Vestige of the Seven Dawns - Approach


Vestige of the Seven Dawns - Establishing


The first sketches I presented SL's team with- In the end they decided on a white temple design but I personally would have loved to go with the red!


First and second thumbnail pass, one with the red temple , and then after a call by the client to switch to white, and expand outwards.



Process with Oculus Medium

item.title: Sketches V by Finnian MacManus
item.description: Sketches over lunch , simplifying forms and a bit of shape design. I find a lot of my gouache studies have impacted how I paint now.
item.content:encoded:
